Dear Madam,
div1.p:
I thank you for your letter of the 28th Decr. which
will be read to the Committee at their next meeting.

No doubt the previous letter I sent to the “Next-of-
kin” has by this time reached you. It suggests that we ought to
have a special form on such occasions when sending our resolutions
of condolence, if such resolutions are likely to be cherished.

On the other hand, a stereotyped note might convey an
impression that it lacks sincerity, which in the case of Dr. Carter
I can assure, you, would be a reversal of the fact.

When your father's portrait was shown to the
Miss Laura A. Carter.
Committee the general impression was that his was a very strong
face, and full of character. one in a thousand.

By this you will understand that we share fully in
your sorrow, and I am very grateful to you for the particulars you
have sent regarding him.
div1.closer:
Reciprocating your kind wishes for 1926,
I am, dear madam,
Yours sincerely, Algernon Rose. Hon. Secretary.
